title: PSM 1 Certification Flashcards - Batch 3
description: Comprehensive Scrum Framework Flashcards covering Roles, Events, Artifacts, and Exam Tips

cards.front: What are the three pillars of Scrum?
cards.back: Transparency, Inspection, and Adaptation.

cards.front: How many roles are defined in Scrum?
cards.back: Three â€“ Scrum Master, Product Owner, and Developers.

cards.front: What is the maximum length of a Sprint?
cards.back: One calendar month.

cards.front: What is the purpose of a Sprint?
cards.back: To create a usable, potentially releasable Increment.

cards.front: Can the scope of work change during a Sprint?
cards.back: Yes, scope may be clarified and renegotiated between the Product Owner and Developers.

cards.front: Who owns the Product Backlog?
cards.back: The Product Owner.

cards.front: What is an Increment?
cards.back: The sum of all completed Product Backlog Items during a Sprint and previous Sprints, meeting the Definition of Done.

cards.front: What is the time-box for the Sprint Planning meeting?
cards.back: 8 hours for a one-month Sprint (shorter for shorter Sprints).

cards.front: What is the Scrum Master responsible for?
cards.back: Promoting and supporting Scrum by helping everyone understand Scrum theory, practices, rules, and values.

cards.front: What is the Daily Scrum's purpose?
cards.back: To inspect progress toward the Sprint Goal and adapt the plan to achieve it.

cards.front: Who facilitates the Sprint Planning meeting?
cards.back: The Scrum Team collaboratively; the Scrum Master ensures it takes place.

cards.front: Who can cancel a Sprint?
cards.back: Only the Product Owner.

cards.front: When should the Sprint Review be held?
cards.back: At the end of the Sprint, before the Sprint Retrospective.

cards.front: What is the purpose of the Sprint Retrospective?
cards.back: To plan ways to increase quality and effectiveness.

cards.front: How long is the Daily Scrum?
cards.back: 15 minutes or less.

cards.front: Can stakeholders attend the Sprint Review?
cards.back: Yes, it's the main opportunity for stakeholder inspection and feedback.

cards.front: Is the Sprint itself a time-boxed event?
cards.back: Yes, typically one month or less.

cards.front: What is the purpose of time-boxing?
cards.back: To create focus and predictability.

cards.front: Can the Scrum Master be part of the Developers?
cards.back: Yes, as long as they fulfill their Scrum Master responsibilities.

cards.front: Is a Sprint Goal required?
cards.back: Yes, it provides focus and guidance for the Sprint.
